text.KPI name and description:
Quality of programme deliverables and activities, and alignment of project outputs to target stakeholders’ learning and evidence needs. Percentage of KPI is measured by taking in consideration supplier’s achievement in quarterly scoring system done by FCDO: 
   • 6 = 100% Outstanding delivery with innovation and outstanding execution, well exceeding contractual requirements.
   • 5 = 83% Proactive supplier delivering efficiently and effectively above contractual expectations.
   • 4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
   • 3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.
   • 2 = 33% Some criteria met but significant improvements needed.
   • 1 = 16% Serious under performance. Not meeting requirements. Immediate and major changes needed
   – KPI description is a summarised version of a more detailed indicator embedded in the contract

text.Contract title and description: Strengthening the teaching of primary school mathematics in Malawi
text.KPI name and description:
KPI2
   Set of  submitted quarterly milestones are of good quality as gauged by the Education Adviser (Technical criterion, weight at 50%) and by the Ministry of Education Director of Quality Assurance (government embedding and sustainability criterion, weight at 50%)
   The milestones are of good quality- i.e., technically strong and well embedded into government systems, facilitating government take-up and sustainability”
   1. Technical criterion- The Education Adviser will gauge the quality of submitted milestones as a whole (the set of milestones as a proxy for progress in implementation, not one by one) based on national and international evidence and given analysis of constraints and opportunities; it will also consider Value for Money and innovation. The Adviser will write a short memo accompanying the score (good/approaching target/requires improvement/inadequate).  
    2. Government embedding and sustainability criterion: the Director of Quality Assurance, who is the government coordinator for the programme, will have a quarterly meeting with FCDO which will be minuted, and score whether the set of milestones are embedding the programme in government systems and are considering sustainability (good/approaching target/requires improvement/inadequate).  
   Good: both technical and government embedding scores are good or one is good and one is approaching target
   Approaching target: both scores are approaching target or one is approaching target and one requires improvement.
   Requires improvement: both scores require improvement or one is requiring improvement and one is inadequate  
   Inadequate: Both scores are inadequate
text.Good target: Both technical and government embedding scores are good or one is good and one is approaching target
text.Comments: Actions were agreed and taken as follows: Cambridge Education allowed the technical director to step down and instead set up three technical teams to lead on revision of workbooks and teacher guides, teachers training model and monitoring and evaluation strategy. The MoE and MIE have taken the lead to ensure institutionalisation and embedding into government system, which is the key concern around quality milestones.

text.KPI name and description: Recruitment of Regular Soldiers: Demand/Baseline Recruit Allocation Plan percentage
text.Comments: KPI 1 reflects Capita’s performance in recruiting soldiers to meet specific monthly targets across a wide range of job roles. With regards KPI 1, the contractor’s ability to achieve recruitment targets during Q3 has been impacted by the ongoing buoyant National jobs market that shows a high vacancy rate, with job postings some 43% above pre-pandemic levels, which means that Capita with the Army offer is competing against many other potential employers to attract recruits to fill these vacancies, whilst at the same time there has been a reduction in the size of the eligible target audience due to changing social demographics. To address these challenges,  Capita is working closely with the Army to drive a number of initiatives seeking to increase overall volumes and further improve conversion rates; these include the recent launch of a new Army website to attract potential candidates, and optimisation of current marketing activities to maximise engagement with main target audiences and generally raise the profile of the Army as an attractive job choice

text.Contract title and description: MSS/107 - MTU Diesel Generator Support
text.KPI name and description: Procurement Lead Time
text.Good target: Equal to or higher than 97 percent
text.Comments:
Rolls-Royce Solutions continue to delivery the majority of spare parts well ahead of schedule.  Due to the volume of spare parts being order by the MoD, one late delivery of a part automatically impacts Rolls-Royce Solutions KPI negatively.  At this point of the contract Rolls-Royce Solutions were assuming a greater volume of spare parts, however due to delays of other projects outside of Rolls-Royce Solutions control this has been further delayed.  Therefore Rolls-Royce Solutions has a negative impact on three fronts, financial impact due to contract KPI’s, financial impact due to reduced number of parts being ordered and the financial impact due to high levels of inflation (fixed cost project).

Rolls-Royce Solutions will continue to work with the MoD to accelerate procurement lead times and improve the KPI during these challenging global supply chain periods.

text.Comments: We continue to work hard to ensure our cash flow projections are as accurate as they can be, and this includes working with all Defence Infrastructure Organisation stakeholders on timings for the various elements of the process that are not always in the supplier’s gift. In addition, the nature of the assets and the moving parts of real estate advice (planning and external stakeholders as an example) don’t naturally fit into a short monthly fiscal cycle. So, to be within 10% with so many moving parts, outside our control, we feel is a positive outcome, whilst we always strive to achieve the contractual targets.
